column5: I may not have caught the biggest over all, but for the OFC tourney I did!LOL Skinny bugger!
I read that too.  I considered writing a letter to the editor lol.

Just wondering if we know who caught the biggest Largemouth and Smallmouth bass of this past season. Biggest for me was a 5lb 8oz and a 5.0oz, never breached the 6lb mark but got over the 4lb mark a couple times.  Hope the ice fishing has been good for everybody, I'll be on my first trip out this coming Sunday/Monday.  Happy Fishing, MTBF  5.0   5-8
Too bad those bass didnt like to eat. They would be monsters if they had guts ... nice bass.

Nice largies !  Got a few smallies over 6.  Here is one from Erie. 6.1 Lbs(weighed)....terrible picture, doesn't do it justice.  I want a 5 LB largie next year !....I will flip till my arms fall off if I have to haha
Well it was in the stomach of my musky, so hard to get an accurate length and weight
Joey, you're a cutie and a smart one too!
Not me.... been targeting specks all season long Nice looking largies Mike btw Leechman

O I know, the first was a little over 22" I think same as the 2nd fish. Easily would of been 6lbr's but that's the game. I fished deep water and caught 3lb fish that were the length of 2lbr's...just got to find the fatty's earlier in the season next summer.  Nice smallie buddy, I had one around 3 and a half out of Sturgeon Lake...nothing any better though.  Let's continue the hunt
I would have to say Garry2R's did on opening day. 7.14 pounds
I skipped the 6 pound club this year and got a 21- 1/2 "  7.2 smallie  on Erie LOL  now in search of the 8 lber
nothing over about 5 this year, but my #'s of fish between 3-5 look promising for the coming years.
If you insist on comparing bait sizes...Here's MY biggest, certainly not THE biggest...
I hate you ...lol
i knew wiser's 7.2 smallie would show up, that thing is huge!!!
Perhaps that's the biggest smallie then of the season. I remember that fish, wow what a pig.
Here's a couple 6's from the spring
Here is a 6.9 from lake Erie
Does it count if I used a 6 pounder for bait?  Nice basses!
This is my biggest for the year never broke 5lbs on LMB but this smally was 5.14lbs on a tourney scale
Both over 6 on tournament scales.
Anyone can catch big bass, it's the little ones that are hard to catch.
I got one of those musky fishing. Yeah you heard me right. The worst part is that was the highlight of my day.
I was fishing for panfish when I caught that little guy and he was my only fish of that day too, hence the picture to prove I caught something.
I just got a Canada Outdoors magazine and some guy sent in a pic of a 12.3lb 25in bass, lol..  I about pissed my pants.

I didn't catch it, but this was the biggest bass I saw all year and he weighted it in at a tourney. Caught by James Paluch during the BPS Lake Simcoe Open Oct 2010 - 8.05 lbs!    It's the one in his right hand ;-)

Well I didn't get the biggest but I might have caught the smallest!!!!  One day on a wind swept bay appropriately named Bass Bay, I got, using a 2 inch minnow on a jig, a real scrapper and a rock at the same time, a 2 inch smallmouth.  My camera quit working prior to the catch so I couldn't get a picture but I measured it against my little finger and it wasn't as long as my finger, but I could still lip it!!!!
